page.title: 17Transport and Travel
page.content: In view of the isolated nature of the D-Block, public transport is very limited. There is no public transport at all on a Sunday, and during the week there are six buses a day from Dalton-in-Furness, two of which continue on to Grisebeck and Broughton-in-Furness. There are more trains,in fact,than there are buses-there are eleven trains per day pass through Kirkby. The station is unmanned ,and so the trains only stop if someone wants to get on or get off. Of those eleven trains,they all come from Barrow (most of them are connections of trains from Preston or further South,but not all) only eight go any further than Millom. It is therefore understandable that the majority of homes in the D-Block are also homes belonging to
